issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: CBO
components.description: All issues dealing with Hive's cost based optimizer and its interaction with Optiq

at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.optimizer.calcite.rules.HiveRelFieldTrimmer.trimFields(HiveRelFieldTrimmer.java:390)
{code}

Reproducible case:
1) set "hive.security.authorization.enabled" to "true" in "hive-site.xml".
2) {code:java}
CREATE TABLE table1 (id int) PARTITIONED BY (year int)

-- create partitioned view
CREATE VIEW view1 partitioned on (year) as select id, year from table1;

set hive.cbo.enable=true;
select year from view1;
{code}
fields.summary: With CBO enabled, Query on partitioned views throws IndexOutOfBoundException

comments.body:
The issue is because in "HiveRelFieldTrimmer.java", partition column is being searched in column list returned by "tab.getCols()". This causes "IndexOutOfBound" error. 
Attaching the patch for the same.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12871506/HIVE-16828.patch

ATTACHMENT ID: 12871529 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

I tried your repro test case on master. It passes without your patch. So, it seems like this is no longer an issue on master. Seems like you have discovered this issue on some previous release. It might be worth investigating which subsequent patch on master fixed this issue and than backport that specific patch for branch you discovered the issue on.
I tried in master, it fails. But it turns out that this happens only when hive authorization is enabled. I have updated the reproducible case details with the same too.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12871529 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

Facing the same issue in Hive 2.1.0. 
The issue is with all types of views. Tried this:
Authorization is enabled.
Create table test_table(id string);
Create view test_view as select * from test_table;
Select * from test_view; -> Throws the mentioned error.

Is there a plan to release the fix for the same anytime soon.?
I changed the underlying the metastore database to mysql from postgres. That worked and the error no longer occurs.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12898088/HIVE-16828.2.patch
